importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: This two-month period covers the initiation and progression of the poisoning, including online searches, purchases of toxic substances, and hospital visits, demonstrating a deliberate and systematic plan.

keyTakeAways: James Craig systematically poisoned his wife Angela Craig using arsenic and tetrahydrozoline (a component in Visine eyedrops), with cyanide added as a secondary lethal agent.
Multiple purchases of toxic substances — including arsenic, potassium cyanide, and tetrahydrozoline — were made using James Craig’s credit card and under fabricated medical justifications.
A deliberate pattern of behavior, including research on poisons, creation of a fake email account, and premeditated purchase and delivery of lethal substances, demonstrates planning and intent.
The use of protein shakes as a delivery method to administer poison highlights a method of concealment that could be replicated in other cases of domestic violence or poisoning.

The involvement of dental office staff, including office manager Caitlin Romero, in noticing suspicious activity and raising concerns underscores the importance of workplace vigilance and reporting mechanisms.
Angela Craig's symptoms were initially misdiagnosed, emphasizing the challenge in identifying poisoning in early stages and the need for increased public awareness and medical training.

summaryOfNewsArticle: James Craig, a former Colorado dentist, was convicted of murdering his wife Angela Craig in March 2023 by poisoning her protein shakes with arsenic, tetrahydrozoline (from Visine eyedrops), and potassium cyanide. The case began with Craig’s romantic relationships and online research into poisons, including searches for murder methods and lethal dosages. Between February and March 2023, he ordered toxic substances via Amazon and King Soopers, created a fake email account to conduct poison research, and used protein shakes as a delivery method. Medical visits revealed worsening symptoms of arsenic and cyanide poisoning, with toxic levels confirmed in blood samples. The plan was uncovered when office staff, including manager Caitlin Romero and business partner Dr. Ryan Redfearn, raised alarms after noticing suspicious deliveries and behaviors. Angela was pronounced brain dead on March 18, 2023, and Craig was later charged with first-degree murder and additional charges related to plotting to kill others while in prison.
title: What we learned about the events leading up to a Colorado dentist poisoning his wife’s protein shakes
